RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the border patrol checkpoint: border patrol checkpoint on I-35 near Laredo, Texas
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the primary inspection lane: primary inspection lane at the border patrol checkpoint on I-35 near Laredo, Texas
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the secondary inspection area: secondary inspection area at the border patrol checkpoint on I-35 near Laredo, Texas
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the border checkpoint: border patrol checkpoint on I-35 near Laredo, Texas

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: country whose government is a party to the appeal and involved in an arson case, with a requirement to file notice of appeal within 30 days after a suppression decision is final
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court that made the judgment of acquittal in favor of Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso and the court from which the appeal is taken, also referred to as the District Court
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: location where a federal grand jury returned an indictment and where Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso was stopped by a border patrol checkpoint, 15 miles south of which the checkpoint is located on I-35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Antonio: destination Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso claimed to be heading to
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.border patrol checkpoint on I-35 near La: checkpoint where Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso's detention was argued to be unconstitutionally lengthy
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.primary inspection lane at the border pa: lane where Agent Jesus Garcia was manning when Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso pulled up
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.secondary inspection area at the border: area where a canine alerted and agents discovered cocaine hidden in the side panel of the car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.I-35: highway where the border patrol checkpoint is located
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.court of appeals: court to which the United States of America must appeal from a decision or order of a district court suppressing or excluding evidence, with jurisdiction over timing requirements for filing notices of appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Article III: part of the legal framework relevant to the case, related to the law of the case doctrine
